restrict: ◎限大三修習◎必須先修過【ENU0283  中級英語聽講（一）】、【ENU0284  中級英語聽講（二）】
description: This course focuses on developing and advancing students’ verbal and aural communication skills needed in academic settings. Main areas covered in class include: academic listening, critical thinking, critical listening, listening strategies applications and lecture note taking skills. During this semester, students will listen to and watch a variety of authentic visual and audio materials on various topics. In addition, the course seeks to develop students’ English discussion abilities and verbal communication skills in academic settings.

syllabus:
**ADVANCED LISTENING**

**Thursdays, 8:10—10:00, Lab 701A                               Class: Junior A**

**Instructor:**  Jean E. Curran, Office: Cheng 714          

**Email: curran.jean@gmail.com**

 **Goals**

The goal of this course is to build upon the listening skills you have developed in both your basic and intermediate listening classes.  These skills include predicting, listening for the main idea, listening for details, critical listening, and vocabulary development.  During the course we will listen and watch a variety of authentic materials. A particular focus this year will be the development of note-taking skills for academic lectures, and exposure to different varieties of English.   

**Materials**

Preiss, Sherry. (2015). _North Star Listening and Speaking, Level 5_ (Fourth Edition). White Plains, NY:

          Pearson Education. 

  

#### Grading: Exams (2) = 40%   Listening Journals = 60%
